intro: Clibadium agreste, commonly known as wild sida, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, pale flowers. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. It is often found in open fields, along roadsides, and in agricultural areas. Clibadium agreste is known for its ability to adapt to different climates and is sometimes considered a weed in cultivated lands.
